intro: Cheniella lakhonensis, commonly known as the Lakhonensis Cheniella, is a rare and unique plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and somewhat woody. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Cheniella lakhonensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
